article.p: Welcome to the gamelab, a new web application for online (mobile and desktop) game theory experimentation. Gamelab allows experimenters to configure two-player normal-form games for time-based play by a pool of participants. Participants accumulate tickets via their payoffs against the average play. At the end of the experiment, their tickets are used in a lottery drawing to select winners.

Gamelab was developed for Jörgen Weibull with financial support from the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Research Foundation. The project design was guided by Eskil Forsell and Jörgen Weibull, and implemented by Kristaps Dzonsons.

section.p: If you're interested in deploying a gamelab server of your own, consult the manual on how to download, install, and administer experiments. If you're interested in teaming up, or just want to share your experiences, contact Jörgen, Kristaps, or Eskil. In the spirit of academic sharing, gamelab is open source ISC licensed, and we kindly suggest that experimenters cite our work!
